field.name: Counsel mothers on good eating habits
During breastfeeding, eat 2 extra meals or “snacks” (extra food between meals) each day to provide energy and nutrition for you and your growing baby
Taking tea or coffee with meals can interfere with your body’s use of the foods
Take iron and folate tablets for at least 3 months after your baby’s birth
Take vitamin A capsules immediately after delivery or within 6 weeks so that your baby receives the vitamin A in your breast milk to help prevent illness
Use iodised salt to help your baby’s brain and body develop well
You need extra care, more food and more rest than an older mother
You need to nourish your body, which is still growing, as well as your growing baby’s
